meanings.definition: Reacting quickly and positively to something
meanings.sent1: She is always very responsive to new ideas in our team meetings.
meanings.sent2: The customer service team is known for their responsive handling of inquiries.
meanings.sent3: The cat was surprisingly responsive to the new toy, chasing it around the room.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden seemed almost responsive to the sunlight, blooming brightly.
meanings.sent5: His smile was as responsive as a spring breeze, lighting up the room instantly.

meanings.sent1: The teacher was responsive to all the students' questions during the class.
meanings.sent2: The automated email system provides a responsive confirmation message.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was so responsive to every question that it seemed like a little professor.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was as responsive as a well-oiled machine, quickly processing and answering each query.
meanings.sent5: The phone line was incredibly responsive, connecting the call in an instant.

meanings.sent1: The team showed a responsive attitude by adjusting their strategy based on new information.

meanings.sent3: The chameleon's color-changing ability is a truly responsive feature in nature.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to problem-solving was as responsive as a gymnast's movements, always finding a way.
